images.description: Lake Baikal is an ancient, massive lake in the mountainous Russian region of Siberia.
Melissani Lake is a cave and cenote located on the island of Kefalonia, northwest of Sami.
Lake Natron is a mineral-rich soda lake with hellish 120-degree temperatures and dangerously low pH levels.
Kayangan Lake is a brackish lake on Coron Island in the Philippines, maintained by the local Tagbanwa people
Jökulsárlón is a glacial lagoon, Its still, blue waters are dotted with icebergs from the surrounding Breiðamerkurjökull Glacier.
Lake Eacham is a volcanic crater lake. It support several types of upland rainforest and a wide range of flora and fauna.
Lake Nakuru is one of the Rift Valley lakes. The lake's abundance of algae used to attract a vast quantity of flamingos that famously lined the shore.
Lake Kawaguchi is the second largest of the Fuji Five Lakes in terms of surface area, and is located at the lowest elevation.
Lake Bacalar is a long, narrow freshwater lake in the state of Quintana Roo, Mexico near Mexico's border with Belize.
Crater Lake lies inside a caldera. Because the lake is filled almost entirely by snowfall, it is one of the clearest lakes in the world.
